Definition: In this task, you are given two phrases: Head and Tail, separated by <sep>. The Head and Tail events are short phrases possibly involving participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words (e.g., PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the subject of the event. You have to determine whether, as a result of the Head, PersonX may feel what is mentioned in the Tail or not. In this task, the feeling is an emotional reaction on the part of X or other participants in an event. For example, as a result of gift-giving, X might feel good about [one]self. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No". The phrase may also contain "___", a placeholder that can be an object, a person, and/or an action.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. As a result of the Head, PersonX will feels satisfied.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX becomes distracted<sep>Tail: They would suffer injuries too.
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, if PersonX becomes distracted, PersonX won't feel what is mentioned in the Tail. So this output is correct.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX finds PersonY's wallet<sep>Tail: glad to help someone get something back.
Positive Examples.explanation: If PersonX finds PersonY's wallet, personX will be glad to help someone get something back. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX accepts ___ in exchange<sep>Tail: to want to compromise
Negative Examples.explanation: If PersonX accepts something in exchange, PersonX will not feel what is mentioned in the Tail. So the output should be "No".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX projects PersonY image<sep>Tail: happy
Negative Examples.explanation: If PersonX projects PersonY image, as a result, PersonX may feel happy, and the output should be "Yes".

Instances.input: Head: PersonX has a pool party<sep>Tail: fun
Head: PersonX quickens PersonY's pace<sep>Tail: helpful
Head: PersonX is skateboarding with PersonX's friends<sep>Tail: fun
Head: PersonX is in PersonX's living room<sep>Tail: comfortable
Head: PersonX has a pool party<sep>Tail: social
Head: PersonX asks PersonY to play<sep>Tail: to spend time with someone
Head: PersonX accepts PersonY's offer<sep>Tail: relieved
